comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Lola Norris was the star witness in the 1913 trial of Maury Diggs and Drew Caminetti, in San Francisco. Diggs and Caminetti, both married men, were accused of violating the Mann Act by transporting their mistresses, Norris and Marsha Warrington, to Reno for immoral purposes. (They were convicted, fined, and sentenced to the federal prison in McNeill Island, WA.) www.pbs.org/unforgivableblackness/knockout/mann.html

comment.author: 11418107@N02
